meanings.definition: A person who is in charge of a boat or ship.
meanings.sent1: The skipper guided the boat safely through the storm.
meanings.sent2: The experienced skipper navigated the ship through rough waters.
meanings.sent3: The skipper's hat flew off in the wind, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She was the skipper of her own destiny, steering towards success.
meanings.sent5: The old skipper's stories of the sea were legendary among sailors.

meanings.sent1: The cat can skipper across the fence with ease.
meanings.sent2: Children love to skipper along the sidewalk on sunny days.
meanings.sent3: The bunny skippered around the garden, hopping from flower to flower.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to skipper by as they enjoyed their day at the park.
meanings.sent5: Her heart skippered with excitement as she approached the finish line.

meanings.definition: To be in charge of a team or group.
meanings.sent1: He will skipper the project team to ensure its success.
meanings.sent2: She skippered the debate club with enthusiasm and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The teacher skippered the class discussion, keeping everyone engaged.
meanings.sent4: She skippered the fundraising event, leading the volunteers with grace.
meanings.sent5: The coach skippered the soccer team to victory in the championship game.
